# Elec-Mate

> The complete digital platform for UK electricians. Training, AI tools, certificates, calculators, and business management — all in one app.

## What is Elec-Mate?

Elec-Mate is a mobile-first web application built for UK electrical professionals. It covers every aspect of an electrician's work: creating BS 7671-compliant certificates, performing complex calculations, studying for qualifications, managing apprentices, and running a business.

## Key Features

- **8 Certificate Types**: EICR, EIC, Minor Works, Emergency Lighting, Fire Alarm, PAT Testing, EV Charger, Solar PV — BS 7671 compliant, digital signatures, offline-capable, professional PDF export
- **70 Electrical & Business Calculators**: Cable sizing, voltage drop, earth loop impedance (Zs), fault current (PSCC/PEFC), RCD testing, conduit fill, maximum demand, power factor, plus 14 business calculators
- **Elec-AI — Like ChatGPT for Electricians**: 8 specialist AI agents + 12 AI tools trained on BS 7671 + UK trade knowledge. Circuit Designer, Cost Engineer, RAMS Generator (30-page docs in 2 mins), Installation Specialist, Maintenance, Regulations Lookup, Study Coach, Voice Quotes, Fault Diagnosis, Board Scanner, and more
- **One-Click Workflows**: AI Circuit Designer → EIC Certificate in one click. EICR Observations → Remedial Quote with cost estimator. Cost Engineer → Professional quote in minutes
- **AM2 Simulator**: Full AM2 practical assessment simulation with timed exercises and AI grading — the only app that offers this
- **AI Portfolio Builder**: Captures evidence and AI auto-maps to assessment criteria
- **EPA Readiness Checker**: Reads your entire portfolio and shows exactly how ready you are
- **30-Page RAMS in 2 Minutes**: AI generates complete CDM 2015 compliant Risk Assessment and Method Statements
- **36+ Training Courses**: 18th Edition, Level 2 & 3, AM2 prep, EPA simulator, HNC, plus 24 CPD courses
- **Business Tools**: AI-powered quoting, invoicing, Stripe payments, Xero & QuickBooks
- **Board Scanner**: Photo a consumer unit → AI identifies every device → imports into certificates
- **ElecID**: Verified digital professional identity card, shareable via QR code
- **Job Vacancies**: Integrated UK electrical job board
- **Employer Dashboard**: Team management, apprentice tracking, compliance monitoring
- **Mental Health Hub**: Confidential wellbeing resources for the construction trade
- **Fully Offline**: Every tool works without internet — auto-saves, syncs when online

## Who is it for?

- Qualified electricians (domestic and commercial)
- Electrical apprentices (Level 2, Level 3, AM2)
- Electrical employers and contractors
- College tutors managing electrical students

## Compliance

All tools and certificates comply with:
- BS 7671:2018 + Amendment 2:2022 + Amendment 3:2024 (IET Wiring Regulations, 18th Edition)
- Part P Building Regulations (England & Wales)
- Electricity at Work Regulations 1989
- The Electrical Safety Standards in the Private Rented Sector (England) Regulations 2020

## Platform

- Works on iPhone, Android, tablet, and desktop
- Progressive Web App (PWA) — install from browser, works offline
- Also available as native iOS and Android app via Capacitor

## Standards Compliance

- BS 7671:2018+A2:2022 (18th Edition IET Wiring Regulations — the "brown book")
- BS 7671:2018+A3:2024 (Amendment 3 — adds Regulation 530.3.201, bidirectional/unidirectional devices)
- BS 5839 (Fire detection and fire alarm systems)
- BS 5266 (Emergency lighting)
- IET Code of Practice for Electric Vehicle Charging Equipment Installation
- MCS Standards (Microgeneration Certification Scheme — Solar PV)
- GN3: Guidance Note 3 — Inspection & Testing (9th Edition / 18th Edition)

## 400+ Free Guides & Resources

Elec-Mate publishes over 400 free guides, calculators, and training resources:

### Certificates & Compliance
- EICR guides (landlords, commercial, observation codes, schedule of inspections, limitations, unsatisfactory results)
- EIC guides (when required, how to fill in, vs minor works)
- Minor works, EV charger, fire alarm, emergency lighting, solar PV, PAT testing guides
- Digital vs paper certificates, certificate retention, NICEIC/NAPIT requirements

### Calculators & Technical Tools
- Cable sizing, voltage drop, earth loop impedance, max demand, PFC, adiabatic equation
- Conduit fill, trunking fill, cable tray, busbar, ring circuit, three phase, power factor
- Disconnection time, cable derating, motor starting current, earth rod resistance
- Lighting lux, transformer sizing, battery backup, solar panel sizing, EV charger load
- IP rating guide, load schedule, power consumption

### Testing & Inspection
- Testing sequence, safe isolation, insulation resistance, continuity R1+R2, polarity
- RCD testing, earth electrode, loop impedance, functional testing, dead vs live testing
- Test instruments guide, Fluke vs Megger, Ze values, maximum Zs values
- Periodic inspection, initial verification, commissioning, three phase testing

### Regulations & Standards
- BS 7671 18th Edition complete guide, Amendment 3 changes
- Part P, building regulations, Electricity at Work Regulations
- Wiring colours UK, special locations Part 7, bathroom/kitchen/outdoor regs
- AFDDs, SPDs, residual current monitoring, protective earthing & bonding
- Notifiable vs non-notifiable work, competent person schemes

### Career & Business
- Electrician salary UK, apprentice salary, day rates, career progression
- How to become an electrician, CV guide, interview questions
- Starting a business, tax guide, CIS, insurance, going self-employed
- Pricing jobs, hourly rates, van setup, tool lists

### Training & Apprentice
- 18th Edition exam tips, AM2 preparation, 2391 exam tips
- Apprentice rights & pay, off-job training, EPA preparation, portfolio building
- Study tips, flashcards, mock exams, site diary guide
- Fire alarm, EV charging, renewable energy, smart home courses

### Troubleshooting
- RCD keeps tripping, earth fault loop too high, low insulation resistance
- Circuit breaker tripping, power going off, flickering lights, burning smell
- Voltage too high/low, overloaded circuit, borrowed neutral, ring circuit faults
